meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to step on; to tread on; to trample on その男は私の足を踏んだのにわびることさえしなかった。The man did not so much as apologize for stepping on my foot.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to set foot on (e.g. foreign soil); to stand on; to visit

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to experience; to undergo 彼女が初舞台を踏んだのは1969年であった。Her first appearance on the stage was in 1969.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to follow (rules, principles, etc.); to go through (e.g. formalities); to complete 何をするにも順序を踏んでやりなさい。No matter what you do, you must follow the correct order.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to estimate; to guess; to judge; to value; to appraise 私はもっと敵の抵抗があると踏んでたんだけど、むしろ中枢に進むほど敵が減ってきてる・・・。おかしいと思わないかしら？I had expected stronger resistance from the enemy but if anything there are less of them as we advance to the centre... Don't you think that's strange?

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to rhyme See also 韻を踏む

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to succeed to (e.g. the throne)
履む 【ふむ】、践む 【ふむ】

meanings.meaning: 1. to be based on; to take into account; to build upon; to have origin in
2. to have one's feet firmly planted on; to plant oneself on
1. to be based on; to take into account; to build upon; to have origin in
2. to have one's feet firmly planted on; to plant oneself on

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to brace one's legs; to stand firm; to plant one's feet (firmly on the ground) 群衆に押されないよう力を入れて踏ん張った。I braced myself against the crowd.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to hold out; to persist; to make an effort; to exert oneself 土壇場で踏ん張ってその契約を勝ち取らない限り、我々は破産も同然だ。If we don't make a last ditch stand at winning that contract, we may very well go under.
踏んばる 【ふんばる】

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb

meanings.meaning: 1. to step into (e.g. someone else's territory); to break into; to raid 君子が恐れて踏み込まぬ所へも愚者は突入する。Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.

2. to come to grips with; to get to the core of 詳しいことが全部わかるまでは、あわててその場にふみこむな。見当がつくまでは、慎重にかまえておれ。Don't rush into the situation until you have all the details; hold your horses until you know where you are going.
1. to step into (e.g. someone else's territory); to break into; to raid 君子が恐れて踏み込まぬ所へも愚者は突入する。Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.

2. to come to grips with; to get to the core of 詳しいことが全部わかるまでは、あわててその場にふみこむな。見当がつくまでは、慎重にかまえておれ。Don't rush into the situation until you have all the details; hold your horses until you know where you are going.

sentences.translation: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
Don't rush into the situation until you have all the details; hold your horses until you know where you are going.
